value.title: Azure Certifications for developers | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, you'll learn about the Azure Certifications for developers.    For more tips and tricks, visit: https://aka.ms/azuretipsandtricks     Get started with 12 months of free services and $200 USD in credit. value.title: Azure Friday | Azure Availability Zones
value.excerpt: Raj Ganapathy joins Scott Hanselman to discuss the new addition to Azure's resiliency offerings – Availability Zones. Azure Availability Zones are fault-isolated locations within an Azure region to help protect customers applications and data from datacenter-level failures with independent power, network,

value.excerpt: Working with Apache Kafka and want to simplify management of your infrastructure? Lena Hall joins Scott Hanselman to show you can keep using Apache Kafka libraries for hundreds of projects, and try Azure Event Hubs behind the scenes to focus on code instead of maintaining infrastructure.  4:44 - Demo

value.title: How to connect and deliver services privately on Azure with Azure Private Link | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Narayan Anamalai joins Donovan Brown to introduce Azure Private Link. value.title: How to generate SSH public key to log into Linux VM | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, you'll learn how to generate SSH public keys to log into a Linux VM with Cloud Shell and BASH on Windows 10. Watch how you can automatically log into a VM without having to put in a password if you SSH into the server.  For more tips and tricks, visit: http://azuredev.tips/

value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, learn how to use Azure Automation with a Windows Machine with PowerShell. Azure Automation makes it easy to do common tasks like, scaling Azure SQL Database up and down and starting and stopping a virtual machine.   For more tips and tricks, visit: http://azuredev.tips

value.title: Learn all about Distributed Application Runtime (Dapr), Part 2 | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Aman Bhardwaj and Yaron Schneider join Scott Hanselman to talk about the actor model of Distributed Application Runtime (Dapr). Dapr is a portable, event-driven runtime that makes it easy for developers to build resilient, microservice stateless and stateful applications that run on the cloud and edge

value.title: Protect your web applications using WAF with Azure Front Door | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Sharad Agrawal and Teresa Yao join Scott Hanselman to introduce Web Application Firewall (WAF) with Azure Front Door. They show how to configure and block malicious attacks against web applications at the edge of Microsoft's network. WAF with Azure Front Door is the best solution to help protect your

value.title: Scale Your Cloud App with Azure Cache for Redis | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Ye Gu joins Scott Hanselman to discuss Azure Cache for Redis, a popular open-source in-memory data store that uses DRAM to store the most frequently used or time-sensitive data for fast retrieval. With it, you can create applications on Azure that handle millions of requests per second at down to sub-millisecond
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/K7_gnzge6Oc" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Automate tasks in SQL Server
value.excerpt: Scripting repetitive tasks in Azure SQL for regular maintenance jobs and multi-instance administration. Automation of error and resource alerts. Configuration of notifications for failures.

topItems.title: Configure automatic deployment for Azure SQL Database
topItems.excerpt: Utilize Azure Resource Manager templates for deploying Azure SQL resources.

topItems.title: Schedule tasks using SQL Server Agent
topItems.excerpt: Explore SQL automation for scheduled tasks and automatic alerts for SQL Server and Managed Instance. Configure extended event sessions for tracing activities.

topItems.title: Manage Azure PaaS resources using automated methods
topItems.excerpt: Explore SQL automation for Azure SQL Database and Open Source databases. Configure elastic jobs and Azure Policy.

value.title: Build the intelligent edge with Azure IoT Edge
value.excerpt: Follow this learning path for a broad and compelling introduction to the fundamentals of building IoT solutions with Azure IoT.

topItems.title: Deploy a pre-built module to the Edge device
Set up an IoT Edge Gateway
topItems.excerpt: This module is theoretical and will walk you through how an IoT Edge device can be used as a gateway.

value.title: Implement a Data Streaming Solution with Azure Streaming Analytics
value.excerpt: In this learning path, discover Azure Stream Analytics streaming data, the concepts of event processing, and integration of Internet of Things (IoT) devices.

topItems.title: Work with data streams by using Azure Stream Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Explore how Azure Stream Analytics integrates with your applications or Internet of Things devices to gain insights with real-time streaming data.

topItems.title: Transform data by using Azure Stream Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create Azure Stream Analytics jobs to process input data, transform it with a query, and return results

value.title: Introduction to AI technology for business leaders
value.excerpt: This learning path helps business leaders discover and describe the primary concepts of AI, and the transformational impact AI can have in their organization.

topItems.title: Introduction to AI technology
topItems.excerpt: Learn the primary concepts and technologies of AI, and how Microsoft is turning the latest AI into tools, products, and services that organizations can leverage

topItems.title: Examine the Microsoft approach to artificial intelligence
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Microsoft creates products, services, and solutions to help organizations leverage AI. Understand how these technologies relate to business problems.

value.title: Introduction to version control with Git
value.excerpt: Git is the leading version control tool and essential for developers. Learn how to leverage Git to track your own changes and collaborate with others.

topItems.title: Introduction to Git
topItems.excerpt: Use Git to track changes and collaborate with other developers

topItems.title: Collaborate with Git
topItems.excerpt: Use Git to track changes to source code and collaborate with other developers

topItems.title: Edit code through branching and merging in Git
topItems.excerpt: Level up your Git knowledge by learning about how to keep code separate using branches and how to merge them later

value.title: Manage cloud resources
value.excerpt: The second learning path in a course on Cloud Administration from Carnegie Mellon University. Learn more about how the cloud works by exploring its underlying technology of virtualization, how to take advantage of the cloud for scale, and how to automate cloud resource management.

topItems.title: Understand virtualization
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Take a deep dive into virtualization by understanding its formal definition as well as the different types of virtual machines.

topItems.title: Scale your cloud resources with elasticity
topItems.excerpt: Cloud Admin course from Dr. Majd Sakr at Carnegie Mellon University. Discover what cloud elasticity means and different ways to scale your cloud resources.

topItems.title: Automate cloud resource management
topItems.excerpt: Cloud Admin course from Dr. Majd Sakr at Carnegie Mellon University. Learn about how to automate cloud resource management with scripts and infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform.

value.title: Analyze text with the Text Analytics service
value.excerpt: The Text Analytics service is a cloud-based service that provides advanced natural language processing over raw text for sentiment analysis, key phrase extraction, named entity recognition, and language detection.

value.title: Deploy and configure servers, instances, and databases for Azure SQL
value.excerpt: Deploy and configure servers, instances, and databases for Azure SQL

value.title: Introduction to Azure SQL
value.excerpt: This module introduces Azure SQL. Learn about various deployment options and service tiers and what to use for your organization.

value.title: Back up and restore databases
value.excerpt: Plan and implement policy for recovering data in case of user error or failure of technology. Explore various options for how and where to backup and restore databases.
